examples: He was in trouble when the rain started.

definitions.definition: A difficulty , problem , condition , or action contributing to such a situation.
examples: The trouble was a leaking brake line.
The bridge column magnified the trouble with a slight tilt in the wrong direction.

definitions.definition: A person liable to place others or themselves in such a situation.
The state of being troubled , disturbed , or distressed mentally ; unease , disquiet .
Objectionable feature of something or someone; problem , drawback , weakness, failing, or shortcoming.
examples: The trouble with that suggestion is that we lack the funds to put it in motion.

definitions.definition: Violent or turbulent occurrence or event ; unrest , disturbance .
Efforts taken or expended , typically beyond the normal required.
examples: It’s no trouble for me to edit it.

definitions.definition: Health problems , ailment , generally of some particular part of the body.
examples: He’s been in hospital with some heart trouble .
My old car has engine trouble .

definitions.definition: Liability to punishment ; conflict with authority .
examples: He had some trouble with the law.

definitions.definition: A fault or interruption in a stratum .
Wife . Clipping of trouble and strife .
An unplanned , unwanted or undesired pregnancy .

Liability to punishment ; conflict with authority .
